medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The proband was a 20-year-old male presenting with hypercalcemia that showed total serum calcium levels of 15.1 mg/dl. At the time of diagnosis there was polyuria and polydipsia. A CT scan showed a hypodense mass in the right neck, and an oral pantography revealed circumscribed radiolucency in the mandible. Surgical exploration revealed parathyroid carcinoma of the right upper parathyroid gland.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The proband developed hungry bone syndrome postoperatively and required treatment with intravenous calcium gluconate and magnesium sulfate, followed by oral calcium and alfacalcidol for 2 months. Additionally, there were no signs of renal stones at the time of diagnosis. The father of the proband was diagnosed with parathyroid carcinoma at age 40, along with hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.family_history: The father of the proband had parathyroid carcinoma and hypertension, alongside type 2 diabetes mellitus. The family exhibited a germline HRPT2 mutation, IVS2-1G>A, linked to their HPT-JT syndrome.
